name: Apéry's constant
summary: Apéry's constant is a mathematical constant, defined as the infinite sum of the reciprocals of the cubes of the positive integers. In symbols, $\gamma(3) = \Sum_{n=1^\infinity}  rac{1/3}$, where $\gamma$ is the Reimann zeta function.
kwds: Diophantine approximation and transcendental number theory
